text:
substance: Trichloroethylene
(TCE) | type_of_trv: Inhalation TC | trv_value: 2.0E-03
mg/m3 | study_details: Keil et al., 2009 | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: LOAEL =
0.35 mg/kg -day
BW
POD (LOAEL)
internal dose
= 0.139 mg TCE
metabolized /
kg 3/4/day
BW
HEC =
99, LOAEL
0.033 ppm
(0.19 mg/m3) | trv_derivation_method: Candidate RfCs derived
using a PBPK model
integrating combined
intraspecies, interspecies,
and route-to-route
extrapolation, and
dividing by a UF.
Candidate RfC (Keil et al.,
2009) = 0.0019 mg/m3
Candidate RfC
(Johnson et al., 2003) =
0.0021 mg/m3
Selected RfC = midpoint
between the candidate
RfCs = 0.002 mg/m3 | critical_effect_s: Developmental
toxicity
(fetal heart
malformations)
and
Immunotoxicity
(decreased thymus
weight) | carcinogenicity_classification: CEPA: Group II
probably
carcinogenic
to humans
(EC and HC, 1993g)
IARC: Group 1
carcinogenic
to humans
(IARC, 2014)
US EPA IRIS:
carcinogenic
to humans
(US EPA, 2011b) | source: US EPA, 2011b
(based on
Keil et al., 2009
and
Johnson et al.,
2003)

substance: Trichloroethylene
(TCE) | study_details: Study Type: chronic
Species: female B6C3F1 mice
Mode of Administration: oral
(drinking water)
Exposure Regime: 0, 1.4, and
14 ppm (0, 0.35, 3.5 mg/kg -day)
BW
Duration: 30 weeks
Uncertainty Factors: 100 (10 for
extrapolating from a LOAEL rather than
a NOAEL, 3 for intraspecies variability,
and 3 for interspecies variability) [total
uncertainty factor rounded to 100]

substance: Trichloroethylene
(TCE) | study_details: Johnson et al., 2003 | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: POD = BMDL
internal dose 01
= 0.0142 mg TCE
metabolized by
oxidation/kg 3/4/day
BW
HEC =
99, BMDL01
0.0037 ppm
(0.021 mg/m3)

substance: Trichloroethylene
(TCE) | study_details: Study Type: developmental
Species: pregnant Sprague-Dawley rats
Mode of Administration: oral
(drinking water)
Exposure Regime: 0, 0.0025, 0.25,
1.5, and 1100 ppm (0, 0.00045, 0.048,
0.218 or 129 mg/kg -day) on
BW
gestational days 1 to 22
Duration: 3 weeks during pregnancy
Uncertainty Factors: 10 (3 for
intraspecies variability, and 3
for interspecies variability) [total
uncertainty factor rounded to 10]

substance: Trichloroethylene
(TCE) | type_of_trv: Oral SF | trv_value: 8.11E-04
(mg/kg -day)–1
BW | study_details: Study Type: chronic
Species: male and female rats
Mode of Administration: gavage
Exposure Regime: 0, 500, and
1000 mg/kg -day, 5 days/week
BW
Duration: 103 weeks
Uncertainty Factors: N/A | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: Range of oral SFs:
5.82E-04 to
8.11E-04
(mg/kg -day)–1
BW | trv_derivation_method: Linearized multistage model
and allometric scaling
Most conservative
oral SF:
8.11E-04
(mg/kg -day)–1
BW | critical_effect_s: Cancer
(kidney
[combined tubular
cell adenomas and
adenocarcinomas]) | source: HC, 2005
(based on
NTP, 1988 and
NTP, 1990)
